G19XzwwNCmPcO3DaQSpPAg.text: Great food & service in intimate non-touristic atmosphere. BYOB (mention Laila's at the Mama's store across the street for 10% wine bottle discount). Grilled Salmon on couscous was excellent and wife said her ratatouille was best she ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom. Salmon and Ratatouille. Great food &amp; service, buy your wine across the street (mention Laila&#39;s for 10% discount).

6_Ve42zI-jDHmUn-in6LTQ.text: Great lunch on the patio. We shared the lamb meatballs and the mezza platter. Both were delicious and flavorful.

ZDtngVAtvsgZxQqehg-scQ.text: This place is quaint and has outdoor seating. The location is right off the royal mile yet walking distance to princes street. Quite perfect for a lunch out while exploring the city.  We had the chicken. I had chicken gyro type thing. It wasn't that great. The chicken was cut into small bits and mixed with some kind of sauce. It was all wrapped in a pita with lettuce & tomatoes. But my eating partner had the grilled chicken thighs. Amazing! The sauce was so good and they were grilled really well. Super tasty.   We also had a starter. A trio of dips. Hummus, babaganoush and tzaziki. None were really that stand out. Pretty bog standard. I would order again but don't expect amazingness. However, we really liked the bread the dips were served with. It was thicker than pita but not crusty bread. It was quite special.

roBwjct4zVYqoAzj35WfoQ.text: After reading all the great reviews, I had expectations that were truly dashed. My chicken salad on salad as requested was served dry, no dressing, not even a slice or f lemon. Wife had a falafel wrap which used curry spices, wrong, and was too spicy. Not a good showing!

taIBvZDO5ef0_xRCkGhsGA.text: Fresh food, great service, BYOB! We ordered the trio drips, soup of the day and chicken salad! All very authentic and flavorful!

tJg3n6IB2dz2Hn1kdYlSGA.text: The food my wife and I had at Laila's was amazing. We ordered the bread with mixed dips - the baba ghanoush and tzatziki dips were out of this world! The oak smoked cheese with tomato sandwich and the chicken skewers were also fantastic. The restaurant is cozy with a homey feel and incredibly friendly staff. Highly recommend and will definitely return here next time we make it to Edinburgh!

balG64f__9wRtxBz34dIEA.text: The only reason that this restaurant gets 2 stars instead of 1 is because the staff was very nice, but we had to wait over an hour for our food which wasn't very good. The chicken shawarma wrap tasted like pure ketchup, the falafel wrap was tasteless, and the rice for the prawn skewers was very mushy. The staff was very very kind, but the food was not nearly ok for the wait.

xDtOioLzH1OYZm0bCFo-RQ.text: I like it. The lamb is very delicious!!!!! The decoration make me feel relax. It's a great place

__2hmTmARMXro8vvH9mVUA.text: Mmmmm ... Such a delicious and refreshing break from pub food. We shared the mezzo plate and our son got the chargrilled chicken on pomegranate rice. Terrific venison salumi. We added the babaganoush because we love eggplants. Incredible homemade middle eastern bread that hit the spot. There was nothing left on our plates. Try the elderflower sparkling cider and be sure to save room for dessert. Definitely a hidden treasure.

1d6KrrpGCWxa48VIrnyAQw.text: Great grilled chicken salad! The chicken was marinated very well. The salad was a decent size especially for lunch. The service was quick as well. It's a nice little spot to pop in if you're looking for a good lunch option. They also offer fish and chips here!

photos.caption: Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom

7bZw2afWzHSpT1WaFzX75g.text: I had a wonderful lunch at Laila's the other day. This is a family restaurant that truly feels like you're in someone's dining room. On a cold and breezy day, Laila's was warm and welcoming.   I had Laila's half chicken, and it was two pieces of white and dark meat heaven, both seasoned and marinated to perfection. I chose a fragrant basmati rice as my side; the small salad that it comes with is also very good.   Price wise they are up there compared to the area but definitely worth it. Do be advised that they add a 1 "charity" charge to your bill. I caught it and asked about it, and was advised that it's optional but I wonder what would have happened if I hadn't noticed it. I left the charge on as it's ultimately not a big deal.   It's too bad that I didn't have room for some of their tiramisu, it looked great!

Ia2dG2VDvF0mBOni1wZXbg.text: We had a wonderful dinner there! The restaurant decoration itself is not that original however I totally recommend this place to enjoy nice mediterrean food! The waitress was really friendly and was happy to share with us any recommendation about the menu. We ordered some stuffed wine leaves to share, my friends ordered the lentil soup of the day and I ordered the falafel wraps. The meals were delicious but very fulfill! It was tasty, full of spices and it seems pretty authentic.  I totally recommend this place for a nice and affordable lunch/dinner when you are graving for Mediterrean food.

photos.caption: Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom

kItiI0gtMkhZv2BUAnx1gw.text: Laila's had excellent Mediterranean food, which was a nice break from the heavy Scottish meals I've been eating recently as a tourist. The service was quick and excellent, and the food was really good. I had the pasta of the day, which had a tomato and aubergine sauce on it, and I also had their caprese salad and olives and bread appetizers. Their mango sorbet was really delicious, and I left the restaurant fully satisfied. We came here on a Saturday evening and were immediately seated, and the location is easy to find.

3t_pWlu1IizYWtistRSX4A.text: Excellent food and atmosphere. Stopped in because we were tired of pub food. Had the chicken breast with pomegranate rice - delicious!

C7MqUJj5uwTpVQ38gU2pCg.text: What a refreshing meal after a week in Scotland! We were so happy to have something that wasn't fish and chips!! The food here was amazing. The portions were absolutely huge and we could've shared! My husband really liked his Moroccan lamb meatballs and the pile of chips that it came with! My falafel hummus wrap was amazing. We also ordered grapeleaves which were strangely chewy (but maybe we are just used to American Mediterranean food) but still good. Stop at Laila's for some healthy variety!

4ur_V26ZpmRKjbm6PTrVrA.text: THE POSTCARD LIFE recommends.  So we were staying literally on the Royal Mile and Cockburn street was a hop skip and jump for us which gave us lots of opportunities to explore the restaurants around. Laila's was the first place we ate at in Edinburgh and we absolutely loved it.  Its quite small but the food is warm, fresh & delicious. We ordered the Feta salad with radishes & croutons, mixed dips with bread & the Falafel wrap. I have to say, the falafel wrap was outstanding. Must must go when in Edinburgh.

3G7jrNUz2ajzmMGt0NBCdQ.text: Out of all the meals we had on our recent Euro trip, Laila's was surprisingly by far our favorite meal. The flavors are incredible, atmosphere is very cute, servers are super polite, prices are great, and it was all around a great experience. We started with the mezze platter. The duck salami was very tasty, Haloumi cheese and cranberry sauce was amazingly crispy, and the hummus was on point. For our mains, we got the lamb meatballs, and the winner of the night was definitely Laila's chicken. The marinade was to die for and the 2 sauces the chicken came with were super flavorful. Highly recommend!

6l59SSbSlwXc-qNQFKoE2g.text: Fantastic food and cute space. I felt like i was back in Palestine! The Morrocan meatballs are particularly good. The restaurant also works with an organization that raises money for Syrian refugees.

u7o6IZlAd9fqCyS5fHLX9Q.text: What a delightful little place!  I took my American parents to a wide variety of restaurants while they were in Edinburgh, as they live in a small town without access to much foodie diversity. As they'd never had Mediterranean before and it's one of my absolute favorites, I was on the lookout for a place that fit the bill--Laila's, happily, was just that!  Laila's is set just off the Royal Mile down Cockburn Street, which is a charming side-street in the heart of Edinburgh. It fits the cuteness of the street well, as the inside of Laila's has amazing atmosphere. The lighting on the walls are particularly snazzy in my opinion! It's cozy but large enough that you feel quite private within, which is lovely in comparison to joints that squeeze in as many tables as possible in their space allotment.  We were warmly welcomed by the staff there, and in no short order we had our drinks (non alcoholic, this place is BYOB though!) and a platter of dips--baba ganoush, tzitziki, and hummus of course, with a lovely basket of bread for dipping. I'll admit the hummus and baba ganoush were pretty standard fare, but the tzatziki was nom-tastic!  Now on to the mains! This is where Laila's really impressed me. My dad had a lamb pasta, my mom had grilled chicken with pomegranate rice, and I myself stuck with a trusty falafel wrap. Four stars all around for solid mains, although I could've gone for a bit more of that trusty falafel fatty, cumin-soaked flavor--have I been corrupted by all the kebab shops in town, perhaps? But the five stars of the evening definitely went to the grilled chicken and pomegranate rice. I'm normally not a huge fan of pomegranates, but that rice was INCREDIBLE. I spent most of the evening trying to sneak as much of it as I could off my mum's plate!  All in all, I think Laila's is a lovely joint with atmosphere, charm, and lovely meals that'll leave you feeling satisfied and certainly far healthier than eating say, yet another fish & chips meal at the local pub!

photos.caption: Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom
Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom
Photo of Laila's - Edinburgh, Midlothian, United Kingdom

MnyWuDVEWYupvpkgps_8Xg.text: Located in Old Town. Had dinner here on our last day in Edinburgh. Cool charming restaurant with friendly service. We order chicken and Shish kabob plates, food was excellent.   They have outdoor seating with great views, but we couldn't find a table outside. Good place to take kids.

qqZFWM8omOjukgoDLyhX1g.text: Laila's on Cockburn Street was a little bit of a surprise. It looks less "hipster" or "pub" from the outside than other restaurants in this very touristy area, but that's actually it's charm.  You walk in and the tables are set up in a way where it feels intimate and you can have a good view of the street and do some people watching.  The Mediterranean style food was perfectly done and full of flavor.  I had the lamb sausage casserole and my boyfriend had the 1/2 chicken special.  Both delicious...and (another surprise) the rice they came with was incredible and also prepared with spices, herbs and peppers that I didn't expect.  At first we were a little disappointed they don't serve beer or wine here, but really....there are plenty of bars to hit up after...and the food is really worth it.

gAsDDbA55Qm-NwkxWSmPQw.text: Very interesting Mediterranean restaurant. I guess people who worked in the kitchen were actual Middle Easterns, because the food was very authentic and seasoned. It was an awesome experience.

z6wPyEARwDXAct-QzdQI7w.text: This is some of the best Mediterranean food I've had. The staff was friendly and helped explain everything on the menu. The Baba Ganoush came with Iraqi bread and it was a great app to split for 2 people.

ccJ8Ui0NdZ7kA3olXnlM6A.text: Delectable and fresh Middle Eastern eats! Friendly service, affordable and well-located in Old Town. We got caught in the rain ('tis the Scottish way of life!) and Laila's stood out as a burst of warmth and comfort. They are BYOB, and there is a place where you can buy wine across the street. If you mention that you're dinning at Laila's you will receive a nice discount :)

GqdnOMlkx0h2HWOCmDuB9g.text: This was just the spot for us.  Having just walked out of a place for one of the worst dinning experiences ever...what a total other world experience here.  Walk in with a half asleep 6 year old since we dod a red eye the night before and the offer pillows for him to rest on.  Made you feel like a friends place.  Totally welcoming!  Now the food...amazing all around.  Chicken schwarma  sandwich, chicken skewers and Lamb Chops all were top notch.  Had the trio dipping plate...which was good but the bread was out of this world.   Will be stopping by here before the end of our trip again for sure.   I don't think you can go wrong with this place!

8tIho1MR1jiIEuD1YlN7-Q.text: Wonderful selection of dishes. We had stuffed Vine (grape) leaves as an appetizer, then doubled down for our entre! Never had them better anywhere!  And the Salmon on grilled veggies with Basmati rice was to die for. Did I mention the delicious warm bread?  BYOB and they gladly provide glasses. Our favorite dinner in Scotland so far during our two-week visit. Very cordial wait staff, too.

AyUok6YTGDKYaKhqxPO9bA.text: Luckily we booked for Saturday night as it was packed. It's quite a small restaurant, they have booths for bigger groups. Food is so so nice. I went for a meze selection- feta salad (this was my favourite), halloumi with cranberry sauce, a potato salad & baba ghanoush with Iranian bread. All was delish. I also tried the grilled chicken skewer- really nice tender chicken with gentle spicing. You only get one skewer but it's enough, there's about 2 chicken breasts on the whole skewer. Didn't really like the Ariani drink (personal taste) - it's a yoghurt drink with salt.   I'd go back just for that feta salad.. Yum. We also took away the baclava and a saffron & cardamom sorbet. Baclava is really nice, quite sticky but I prefer that. Oh and it's BYOB no corkage.

NV5z1Ndf0MdiWoCrGCioXA.text: Ended up here at 10pm on a Saturday night (Valentine's, actually) after finishing a ghost tour.  I was hungry but didn't want to overdo it, since it was going to be bedtime soon enough. And I will admit it, the free wifi got me through the door, bc free wifi is like gold when I am traveling internationally.    Got seated promptly, and the waitress let me know the kitchen was close to closing, so my options were limited.  She said falafel, I said OK (I love falafel).  I was expecting the usual wrap, some cucumbers and tomatoes, tahini, etc.  This was SO MUCH better.  Easily the best falafel sandwich I have had.  The falafel itself was good, and plentiful, but what made it special was they had wrapped it and then essentially panini pressed it, and the cucumbers and tomato seemed to be dressed or lightly pickled.  It was just delicious, and I wish I had found it sooner so I could have gone there again.  The service was great - waitress was very sweet, checked on me but wasn't annoying, etc.

33rPW9sIPhGVNU7nstp9aQ.text: Great to finally find delicious food in Edinburgh. I am Mediterranean and perfectly know good Mediterranean food. Laila's was a pleasant surprise. I had the chicken skewer. The meat was tender and moist and had a rich flavor. The place is cozy and sitting outside people watching was fun. Service may have been a little slow but in their defense it was a Saturday night during the Fringe. Staff were very friendly. Definitely will come back next time in town.
